result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Folley

defendant.name: Folley, Jeremiah
defendant.address: 5225 West Goodrich Lane, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Plea Questionnaire /  Waiver of Rights and Addendum filed.

Defendant Jeremiah Folley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jeremiah Folley.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defendant is in custody in Ozaukee County Jail on separate matter.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah Folley in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jeremiah Folley.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and is waiting on an offer from the State.  Defense requests adjourned hearing to allow possible resolution.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Folley in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Schlei. Court took judicial notice of 22CF58 (Ozaukee County). State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to Branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah Folley in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD to appoint Attorney O'Reilly pending a conflict check. Defendant is reminded to continue working with Justice Point. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jeremiah Folley in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Jeremiah Folley in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah Folley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
